Package src

Interface BinaryHeapInterface<T extends Comparable<? super T>>

All Known Implementing Classes:
MaxHeap
public interface BinaryHeapInterface<T extends Comparable<? super T>>
The BinaryHeapInterface that hosts definitions for methods integral for the creation of any heap. Heaps that implement this interface can be a Max Heap, Min Heap, or any other special type of tree that places a restriction on where entries can be added. We achieve this by using the canAdd(int, T) method which returns a boolean denoting whether or not an entry can be added at that position. So, for a maxHeap, we would check if the entry is less than its parent. We also define that the generic type T is comparable. Each method is documented separately.
Version:
2.0
Author:
Pierlorenzo Peruzzo, George Matta

    T
    remove()
    Removes an entry from the Heap For a MaxHeap, it would be the largest value in the heap For a MinHeap, it would be the smallest value in the heap

  • Method Details

    • add

      void add(T entry)
      Adds an entry to the Heap
      Parameters:
      entry - The entry we want to add to the Heap

    • remove

      T remove()
      Removes an entry from the Heap For a MaxHeap, it would be the largest value in the heap For a MinHeap, it would be the smallest value in the heap
      Returns:
      the item removed from the heap

    • canAdd

      boolean canAdd(int index, T entry)
      Checks if we can add an entry to a given index.
      Parameters:
      index - The index we want to place the entry at.
      entry - The entry we want to add
      Returns:
      true if we can add the entry, false if we cannot

    • getParentIndex

      int getParentIndex(int childIndex)
      Gets the index of a parent given the index of the child.
      Parameters:
      childIndex - The index of a child node.
      Returns:
      THe index of the child's parent.

    • getChildIndex

      int getChildIndex(int parentIndex)
      Gets the index of a child given the index of the parent.
      Parameters:
      parentIndex - The index of a parent node.
      Returns:
      The index of the first child of the parent (add 1 for the second child).

    • isEmpty

      boolean isEmpty()
      Checks if the Heap is empty
      Returns:
      true if the heap is empty, false if it isn't
